properties.areaDesc: Taconite Harbor to Silver Bay Harbor MN
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Warning issued January 16 at 12:54AM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Duluth MN
properties.description:
...STRONG WINDS AND AREAS OF HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY THIS MORNING...

.Strong downslope winds will continue over portions of the North
Shore waters early this morning. Gales of 35 to 40 knots are
expected from Taconite Harbor to Grand Portage, MN. The strong
winds will result in building waves over the North Shore waters
and heavy freezing spray will likely accompany those strong winds.
Conditions will remain hazardous to smaller vessels for the
waters except from Two Harbors to Duluth, MN to Port Wing, WI.
Heavy freezing spray is also likely from Port Wing to Bayfield, WI
due to the combination of Arctic air, strong winds, and building
waves. Wind and waves will subside later this morning as high
pressure moves into the region.

* WHAT...Heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or
greater may rapidly accumulate on vessels. Northwest winds 15 to
25 knots with occasional gusts to 35 knots and waves 1 to 4
feet.

* WHERE...Taconite Harbor to Silver Bay Harbor MN.

* WHEN...Until 9 AM CST this morning.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of stability.
Conditions will be hazardous to small craft.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on
their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area
or conduct mitigation.

Anyone operating a smaller vessel should avoid navigating in
hazardous conditions.

NWSheadline: HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING
